```{python}
#|echo: false
#|eval: true

df_cleaned = pd.read_csv("../soohy/df_cleaned.csv")

import plotly.graph_objects as go
import numpy as np

# ê³µí†µ ë³€ìˆ˜ ë¦¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸
common_features = ['TotalArea', 'YearBuilt', 'GrLivArea', 'OverallQual', 'Total_sqr_footage']
x_var = common_features[0]  # ê¸°ë³¸ Xì¶•

# ì´ˆê¸° íšŒê·€ì„  ê³„ì‚°
x = df_cleaned[x_var]
y = df_cleaned['SalePrice']
coef = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)  # 1ì°¨ íšŒê·€
reg_line = coef[0] * x + coef[1]

# Figure ìƒì„±
fig = go.Figure()

# ì‚°ì ë„
fig = fig.add_trace(
    go.Scatter(
        x=x, y=y,
        mode='markers',
        marker=dict(color='steelblue', size=8, line=dict(width=1, color='DarkSlateGrey')),
        name='Data'
    )
)

# íšŒê·€ì„ 
fig = fig.add_trace(
    go.Scatter(
        x=x,
        y=reg_line,
        mode='lines',
        line=dict(color='red', width=2),
        name='Regression Line'
    )
)

# ë“œë¡­ë‹¤ìš´ ë²„íŠ¼ ì„¤ì •
buttons = []
for feature in common_features:
    x = df_cleaned[feature]
    y = df_cleaned['SalePrice']
    coef = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)
    reg_line = coef[0] * x + coef[1]
    buttons.append(
        dict(
            label=feature,
            method='update',
            args=[
                {'x': [x, x], 'y': [y, reg_line]},
                {'xaxis.title': feature,
                 'title': f'{feature} vs SalePrice'}
            ],
        )
    )

# ë ˆì´ì•„ì›ƒ ì„¤ì •
fig = fig.update_layout(
    title=f'{x_var} vs SalePrice',
    template='plotly_white',
    width=1000,
    height=600,
    xaxis_title=x_var,
    yaxis_title='SalePrice',
    updatemenus=[
        dict(
            buttons=buttons,
            direction='down',
            showactive=True,
            x=0.5,
            xanchor='center',
            y=1.15,
            yanchor='top'
        )
    ]
)

fig
```
